title: What Slayer’s Kerry King Can’t Live Without
text:
B.C. Rich Kerry King Signature V KKV Solid-Body Electric Guitar Black, Used

Except for a 10-year period in the ’90s when I was on ESP guitars, I’ve been on B.C. Rich guitars — and generally they’re custom-made for me. We come up with a paint design, and that becomes the model fans can buy. What people probably don’t really consider is that we have three different guitar rigs across the world at any given time. So you have to use your A rig, your B rig, your C rig, depending on where you’re performing. It cuts down on shipping, and it’s cost effective for traveling the world. So there are guitars I don’t even see until I see a particular rig. I’m going to guess I’ve got about 30 guitars? That’s ballpark. I could be way off.
description: Slayer’s Kerry King shares his favorite things, including a Mitchell & Ness Fred Biletnikoff Oakland Raiders Throwback Jersey, Judas Priest’s Stained Class CD, Pantene Sulfate-Free Conditioner, and Jim Jefferies Freedumb album.
